title: Erdős Problem #494
description: If ... is a finite set and ... then let\[A_k = \{ z_1+\cdots+z_k : z_i\in A\}.\]For ... does the multiset ... (together with the size of ...) uniquely determine the set ...?

overview.problemStatement: If $A\subset \mathbb{C}$ is a finite set and $k\geq 1$ then let\[A_k = \{ z_1+\cdots+z_k : z_i\in A\textrm{ distinct}\}.\]For $k>2$ does the multiset $A_k$ (together with the size of $A$) uniquely determine the set $A$?
